item.title: Problem 6: Sum square difference
item.description: Problem The sum of the squares of the first ten natural numbers is, \[ 1^2 + 2^2 + \dots + 10^2 = 385 \] The square of the sum of the first ten natural numbers is, \[ (1 + 2 + ... + 10)^2 = 55^2 = 3025 \] Hence the difference between the sum of the squares of the first ten natural numbers and the square of the sum is 3025 âˆ’ 385 = 2640.
